intro: Veronica teucrium subsp. javalambrensis, commonly known as the Javalambrense speedwell, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or mountainous areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branched. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
